message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about tectonic plates and their movement. Tectonic plates move along planar fractures, also known as fault lines. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no such term as "error lines" in relation to tectonic plate movement. Option (C) is incorrect because triangular fractures are not a known factor in plate tectonics. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no specific term or concept called "defect line" in plate tectonics.

This question requires knowledge about tectonic plate movement. Tectonic plates are large sections of the Earth's crust that float on the semi-fluid asthenosphere beneath them. The movement of these plates is primarily driven by convection currents in the underlying mantle. As they move, tectonic plates interact with each other along planar fractures known as fault lines. Therefore, option (A) is the correct answer. Options (B), (C), and (D) are all incorrect as they do not accurately describe the fractures along which tectonic plates move.

This question requires basic knowledge about tectonic plate movement. Tectonic plates move along planar fractures, which are also known as fault lines or faults. These fractures occur where the Earth's crust is broken and allows for movement of the tectonic plates. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no term "error lines" in geology. Option (C) is incorrect because triangular fractures are not associated with tectonic plate movement. Option (D) is incorrect because there is no specific term "defect line" used in geology.
